Function Documentation

void ones ( double *  A,
const int  m,
const int  n 
)

Equivalent to Matlab's ``A = ones (m,n)''. Treats A as a flat (1-D) array; it may be either column-oriented or row-oriented.

void print_dense_matrix ( FILE *  out,
const double *  A,
const int  m,
const int  n,
const char *  trans 
)

Prints the given dense column-oriented m x n matrix to the given output stream.

Parameters:
out [OUT] Output stream
A [IN] Dense column-oriented m x n matrix
m [IN] Number of rows in A
n [IN] Number of columns in A
trans [IN] If "T", prints the transpose of the input matrix A. The order of the m and n parameters should not be changed. This option can be used to print a row- oriented matrix.

void print_dense_vector ( FILE *  out,
const double *  x,
const int  length 
)

Prints the given dense vector x[0:length-1] to the given output stream.

double* transpose_dense_col_oriented_matrix ( const double *  A,
const int  m,
const int  n 
)

Returns the transpose of the given column-oriented dense matrix.

void unit_vector ( double *  v,
const int  n,
const int  which 
)

Fills v[0:n-1] with the which-th unit vector.

void zeros ( double *  A,
const int  m,
const int  n 
)

Equivalent to Matlab's ``A = zeros (m,n)''. Treats A as a flat (1-D) array; it may be either column-oriented or row-oriented.
